title: What are some big songs that never made the UK top 10? - Quora

response.answer_text: What’s a big song? If it sold in the millions, likely it troubled the UK top ten. Except for niche parochial music like Country. So something like Cruise by Florida Georgia Line? Reached 75 in the UK top 100. And that’s in the digital download age where having to go and buy a physical copy of a record is less common. The song was available to anyone with a net connection and a credit card. Cruise (song) - Wikipedia Then there’s those songs that get some people instantly singing along, and are highly recognisable: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dust_in_the_Wind Piano Man (song) - Wikipedia Free Bird - Wikipedia Let's Get It On (song) - Wikipedia Born to Run (Bruce Springsteen song) - Wikipedia Baby Got Back - Wikipedia Nope, not a top ten amongst them.

The Pet Shop Boys 1986 single “Love Comes Quickly”; it peaked at 19 on the UK Chart, far below “West End Girls” at #1. Neil Tennant has referred to the song as a band favourite, and it’s one of mine as well. Many years ago, I summoned the courage to make a second attempt to ask out a girl I worked with, only to receive the dreaded “I don’t see you that way, isn’t it obvious?” I apologized, and agreed that we had little in common. It was true, but I was still smitten. As I drove away, the local FM station played the very song… it still resonates with me. Love Comes Quickly - 2001 Remaster
